sen.j: 夜御殿（よるのおとど）は、清涼殿の天皇の寝所である。
sen.e: Yoru-no-otodo meant a bed room for the emperor in the Seiryo-den.
Yoru-no-otodo is the bed room for the emperor in Seiryoden.
Yoru-no-otodo is the bed room for the emperor in Seiryoden.

sen.j: 清涼殿の身屋であり、昼御座の北、二間（ふたま）の西、萩戸（はぎのと）・藤壺上御局（ふじつぼのうえのみつぼね）の南、朝餉間（あさがれいのま）の東2間4方。
sen.e: It is a main room, the 2 ken square room, of the Seiryo-den, placed on the north side of Hi-no-omachi (Emperor's office), on the west side of Futama, on the south side of Haginoto・Fujitsubo no ue no mitsubone and on the east side of Asagarei-no-ma.

It is a main room, about 13 sq.m., in Seiryoden, located on the north side of Hi-no-omashi (Emperor's office), on the west side of Futama, on the south side of Haginoto and Fujitsubo-no-ue-no-mitsubone and on the east side of Asagarei-no-ma.
sen.cmt: ken -> sq.m.に換算しました。参照：見取り図http://tukineko.pekori.jp/heian/dairizu/seiryou.html#seiryou
sen.e: It is a main room, about 13 sq.m., in Seiryoden, located on the north side of Hi-no-omashi (Emperor's office), on the west side of Futama, on the south side of Haginoto and Fujitsubo-no-ue-no-mitsubone and on the east side of Asagarei-no-ma.

sen.j: 南面に大妻戸（またはたたき戸）があり、その左右は壁、東西両面とも北よりの1間が妻戸、南よりの1間はともに壁、北面は2間とも妻戸、帳は枕の方（東）に厨子2つ、あとの方に鏡掛があり、衣架も立てられた。
sen.e: There was 大妻戸 (or Tataki-do) between walls on the south side of Yoru-no-otodo, Tsumado of 1ken which was close to the north was placed on the both east and west sides, 1ken which was close to the south was wall, 2ken on the north side were Tsumado, Tobari (curtain) and two of Zushi were placed on Emperor's bedside (the east side), Kagami-kake or Kagami-tate (mirror stand) was put on the other side and Ika (clothes rack) was also placed.
sen.cmt: ・「大妻戸」の読み不明。漢字のまま英訳。・「帳は枕の方（東）に厨子2つ」⇒意味解釈は『帳と厨子２つが枕の方（東）に位置する』と解釈しました。
sen.e: There is an Otsumado (or Tataki-do) on the south wall of Yoru-no-otodo, Tsumado of 1.82 m in breadth located on the northerly walls on both east and west sides of the room leaving southerly 1.82 m as walls, two 1.82 m wide Tsumados on the north side, Tobari (curtain) and two of Zushi are placed in the direction of Emperor's pillow, east, Kagami-kake or Kagami-tate (mirror stand) is put on the other side, and Ika (clothes rack) is also placed.
sen.cmt: 南の壁に大妻戸があるとしているので、英文では「左右は壁」を省略しました。参照：見取り図http://tukineko.pekori.jp/heian/dairizu/seiryou.html#seiryou見取り図から北側には妻戸が２つあると解釈しました。原文では「厨子２つ」とありますが、夜御殿の調度品としては「二階厨子」（一つの調度品）があり、この間違いではないかと思われます。原文のまま訳していますが、「二階厨子」の場合は'nikai-zushi (a small cupboard with a shelf on top)'です。（用語集より）参照：調度品http://www.cyber.cs.ritsumei.ac.jp/GENJI/2003/Museam/choudohin/oogata/oogata.html
sen.e: There is an Otsumado (or Tataki-do) on the south wall of Yoru-no-otodo, Tsumado of 1.82 m in breadth located on the northerly walls on both east and west sides of the room leaving southerly 1.82 m as walls, two 1.82 m wide Tsumados on the north side, Tobari (curtain) and two of Zushi are placed in the direction of Emperor's pillow, east, Kagami-kake or Kagami-tate (mirror stand) is put on the other side, and Ika (clothes rack) is also placed.

sen.j: 繧繝縁（うんげんべり）の畳2枚を並べ敷き、さらにその上に1枚を敷き、座とした。
sen.e: Two Tatami mats with Ugen-beri (the hem with a pattern of brocade consisting of alternating dark blue and yellow stripes) were placed and another mat was put on top for Emperor's seat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Two Tatami mats with Ugen-beri (brocade hems with strip patterns of some colors) were placed and another mat was put on top for Emperor's seat.
sen.cmt: 繧繝縁の色についての具体的な記述は避けました。参照：繧繝縁http://www.kariginu.jp/kikata/hoka.htmhttp://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/u/ungenberi.htm
sen.e: Two Tatami mats with Ugen-beri (brocade hems with strip patterns of some colors) were placed and another mat was put on top for Emperor's seat.

sen.j: 壁代をかけた東南の厨子に八尺瓊勾玉・天叢雲剣を覆に入れて奉安した。
sen.e: Yasakani-no-magatama (grand jewel; one of the three Imperial regalia) and Ame-no-Murakumo-no-Tsurugi (literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds"; one of the three Imperial regalia) were enshrined in Zushi on the southeast with hanging Kabeshiro (partition).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yasakani-no-magatama (grand jewel; one of the three Imperial regalia) and Ame-no-Murakumo-no-Tsurugi (the sword Ame-no-Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds"; one of the three Imperial regalia) were enshrined in Zushi with hanging Kabeshiro (partition) in the southeast corner.
sen.cmt: 「東南の厨子」は「東南の角にある厨子」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Yasakani-no-magatama (grand jewel; one of the three Imperial regalia) and Ame-no-Murakumo-no-Tsurugi (the sword Ame-no-Murakumo, literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds"; one of the three Imperial regalia) were enshrined in Zushi with hanging Kabeshiro (partition) in the southeast corner.

sen.j: 帳の南・西・北は畳を敷き、女房の座とした。
sen.e: Tatami mats were placed on the south ・west ・north sides of Tobari for Nyobos' (court ladies') seat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tatami mats were placed for Nyobos' (court ladies') seats on the south, west, and north sides of Tobari.
Tatami mats were placed for Nyobos' (court ladies') seats on the south, west, and north sides of Tobari.

sen.j: 四隅の燈火は終夜、消えないように注意し、蔵人が非蔵人に注油（あぶらそそぎ）をもたせ、たたき戸をあけ、非蔵人を戸の下に立たせ、巽角から始め、艮角で終わるように注し、帳の東、すなわち枕許を通らなかったという。
sen.e: Tomoshibi (lights) on the four corners were kept on all night and Kurodo (Imperial archives keeper) let Hikurodo (Imperial secretariat) to hold Abura-sosogi (oil pot) and opened Tataki-do (door) and then let Hikurodo to stand under the door; they began to pour oil from the southeast direction and finished it to the northeast direction; in addition, they did not go past the east side of Tobari or Emperor's bedside.

Lamps on the four corners were kept all night through and Kurodo (Chamberlain) have Hikurodo (trainee in the Kurodo dokoro, or the Imperial Secretariat) hold Abura-sosogi (oil pot) and stand by Tataki-do (door) as he opened the door; they poured the oil from the southeast corner finishing it in the northeast corner so that they did not pass the east side of Tobari where Emperor's pillow was placed.
sen.cmt: Imperial archives keeper-> Chamberlain蔵人の当初の役割はArchive Keeperが当てはまりますが、後にChambelianの役割も果たすようになり、原文の内容ではChamberlianの方が分かりやすいため変更しました。Under the door -> by the doordirection -> cornergo past -> pass
sen.e: Lamps on the four corners were kept all night through and Kurodo (Chamberlain) have Hikurodo (trainee in the Kurodo dokoro, or the Imperial Secretariat) hold Abura-sosogi (oil pot) and stand by Tataki-do (door) as he opened the door; they poured the oil from the southeast corner finishing it in the northeast corner so that they did not pass the east side of Tobari where Emperor's pillow was placed.

sen.j: 板敷の下は湿気を取るために3尺ほど掘り下げたという。
sen.e: Places under itajiki (wooden floor) were dug about three jaku (90.9cm) to eliminate moisture.
There was a space dug about 90.9 cm under itajiki (wooden floor) for dehumidification.
There was a space dug about 90.9 cm under itajiki (wooden floor) for dehumidification.
